title: Ticket #4391: Cream jobs with spooled executable fail at startup
description:
In #3589, we attempted to fix a bug with CREAM jobs when copy_to_spool=True is set in the submit file. In that fix, we transferred the correct file for the job executable, but gave it the wrong name. The file that we put on the CREAM server had the name of the file in the spool directory, but the filename we told CREAM to run came from the Cmd attribute of the job ad.

Now, when we transfer the executable, the destination filename matches the Cmd attribute.
check_ins:

2014-May-30 10:57   Check-in [40283]: Cream jobs with spooled executable fail at startup. #4391 When copy_to_spool=True, we used inconsistent filenames for the job executable on the CREAM server. This resulted in CREAM failing to start the job. Now, the filename on the CREAM server always matches the Cmd attribute of the job ad. (By Jaime Frey )
creator: jfrey
